author: chrobilliard
title: Migrate nano-credits to Cardano
description: The current financial system doesn't know how to trust the underserved. High default rates, and no trust in legacy institutions.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is trying to migrate the already active micro-lending app services ‘kashin’ to Cardano, Hence it is aligned with the Challenge as it is trying to solve B2C problem.
They are inspired by the MELD protocol. The proposer looking for the support of the Cardano community as they will be relying on stakepool rewards for additional funding. In turn, the stake delegators will be rewarded with new Cardano native tokens in the line of MELD protocol. This will help in bringing many users to the Cardano ecosystem.
Currently, they are operating in Peru, with immediate plans to expand to Columbia and Mexico. On a long-term note, the proposer is planning to expand to other Latin American countries. Hence the services provided by this project are on the verge to scale to include larger geography. 
 
 The micro-lending market is underutilized as many in the informal sector do not have access to it. If ‘kashin’ can be successful in streamlining these services with the help of the Cardano blockchain, its impact will be noticeable and help our ecosystem to grow.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal will likely be executed successfully considering they are already active in the market & the plan of migration to Cardano is laid out with details.
The team seems to be qualified and their LinkedIn profiles have been shared.  They are partnering with other Cardano community members such as the Armadillo pool operator for the launch of the stakepool. The proposer also looking for a partnership with MELD for the provision of liquidity. The developer required by the project seems yet to be hired for the native token launch and operation.
The budget is reasonable as it is 50% of the amount required to launch stakepools, token launch & operation, etc., 
 
The timeframe has been provided by the proposer and all the mentioned stages such as stakepool launch, native token launch, and incorporation in BVI along with other legal matters are scheduled to be completed within 6 months post-funding. 
 
Additional funding will be coming from stakepool rewards as the proposer will run a 100% margin stakepool and delegators will be entitled only to the protocol new Cardano native tokens. Apart from this, the proposer is looking for liquidity from MELD. 
 
 Considering all the details above it is likely this proposal will be executed in migrating the services to the Cardano blockchain but it will interesting to see the onboarding of the number of nano loan seekers to the protocol.
f6_assessments.q2:
The timeframe has been laid out in months to complete the various steps of the plan. This can be used to track the progress and audit the proposal advancement. As mentioned the proposal’s progress can be tracked with the amount of stake with the ‘kashin’ stakepool but additional details will be helpful to form an opinion about the progress as the amounts mentioned are vague. 
 
 As mentioned by the proposer the success of this proposal will be judged with the number of nano loans but I cannot see how they are going to market or onboard the loans seeker to the protocol. It would have been great if they can provide the number of people they will onboard within the next 3, 6, 9 & 12 months.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is well aligned to the challenge. It demonstrates a real need of partnering with an existing-ready product/service that could be converted to Cardano. The information provided, reveals that the proposer understands the current financial systems and the gaps therein, has been practically involved in closing these gabs and to some extent has succeeded. The information in the proposal demonstrates how using Cardano tech solutions will improve the credit financial systems to serve all (the formal and informal economy), will increase funding potential and reduce defaulting rates thereby creating entrepreneurial opportunities to ADA holders as well providing a service to the “marginalized’ informal economy. The approach, strategies and activities are sufficient to achieve the intended objectives. This proposal reveals that it will create local and global impact and its highly scalable.
f6_assessments.q1: The information provided in the proposal demonstrates the fact the team is passionate about what they do, they have great experience in their specific roles and in working together, they have a support system in form of mentors and all this is sufficient for a successful implementation of the proposal. In addition, the B2B & B2C responsibility agreements are clearly defined – the proposer’s and funder’s contribution/responsibility are well defined. The plan and timeframe clearly defined, the budget is defined and well explained. The risks taken into consideration. The expected outcome/impact surpasses the expected risk and cost of funding.
f6_assessments.q2:
The KPIs, roadmap, milestones and delivery dates are clearly defined the project progress can be easily audited by the cardano community. 

This project is worthy all the funding and support -  Its timely and it position Cardano as a leader in solving real challenges to communities.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problems are well presented to show the necessity of their solution in the proposal. Their solution “Collaborative Credit Scoring” is mentioned with some specific statistics to prove their low default rate. The main feature showing how their product works and their ultimate goals are effectively discussed, which are predicted to solve the existing problems. However, in this part, they need to point out the expected results and explain how they gonna affect their target audience and the overall Cardano community. 
Some risks are predicted and the proposers also ensure the measures taken to address them. However, it would be better if these challenges and management plans were specifically mentioned so that the community would have more evidence to assess their proactivity as well as the effectiveness of these solving steps.
f6_assessments.q1:
They well listed down 3 principal works that need to be done by a particular deadline. For better understanding, they need to divide it into a bit more detail, for example, every possible step to take during the creating and evaluating the performance process of 2 stake pools. By this detailed timeline, the community will be able to see all the action plans and consider whether the time spent on each task is reasonable or not. A well-matched budget breakdown with the action plan is provided. The clear number for each estimated cost allows the community to properly assess the rationality and adequacy of their spending compared to the developmental orientations
They provided a very detailed description of their team including highly experienced leaders, mentors, backup institutions, and reliable partners. The team is well described with specifically achieved results during 11 months of operating together with their Android App and website, which can be a good source for the community to see their growth prospects. I believe this is a strong team with the spare capacity to run the project smoothly
f6_assessments.q2: The team proposes particular desired results. All the relevant KPIs are set with specific acquired numbers and milestones, helping them and the community better measure the progress and the development of the project. They have clearly visualized their success by providing certain outcomes (Issue more than 1'000,000 nano-loans…by the end of 2023), which demonstrates their exhaustive understanding of the project along with their strategic vision for future development. Their goals and achievements are proven to be firmly linked to the SDG

f6_assessments.q0: I believe that the micro lending business model offered by the team can answer these needs. It can connecting people in need of affordable loans with lenders who wish to invest their money in micro enterprises. However, we must ensure that the credit is used for production activities and not for consumptive activities. Credit on productive activities has a greater impact on people because their income will increase and in the end they will have a better life. So, I recommend collaboration with local partners to held financial literacy awareness in the kashin area of operations regularly.
f6_assessments.q1: Eventhough Proposer carries a noble mission to help those who work in the informal sector, I expect the majority of investors expect liquid returns. So it will face challenges to have 100% of the rewards generated toward the funding pool. Proposer needs to provide a more liquidity (allocation from the return) for investors to cashout on KSHN tokens which will be distributed later. In addition, I believe that the economic cycle also affects the default rate of borrowers, so it is better to create a sharing responsibility mechanism through financing to a groups consisting of several people. Finally, to enables seamless funding, Kashin may build a web-based and application based platform to enable borrowers to request and to make payment loan only. They can’t purchased K-stablecoin to minimize volatility risk of owning cryptocurenccy.
f6_assessments.q2: If Proposer understands that the concept of multipools does not carry the spirit of decentralization in Cardano, maybe Proposer can consider other concepts such as ISPO, FISO, or others. Besides that, I expect Proposer will have Social Accountability Report that highlight socio economic impact resulted from business activites and intervention program. Make sure the metric will presented using a validate measurement methodology like ratio of genders, avg. monthly income, number of borrower who have bank accounts, and number of field officers that will help you to running the business activities.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal has very well-addressed problems and solutions with evidence (more than 70% of Latin Americans are marginalized by the traditional credit system). Their solutions to the problems are also suitable to the challenge's target.
f6_assessments.q1: The timeline is clear. The budget is reasonable and requests only 50% of the total funds. The team's introduction was impressive since they are an already existing company. Although the company is new (only 11 months of operation), we can see that they have achieved remarkable results. All their employees and mentors are well-known names in their field.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has a really clear vision of this project. This can be seen in the way they measure its success with goals achieved after 1 month, after 3 months, after 6 months, and after 12 months. All the goals are included with KPI. The team also has a sustainable development growth rating which is a nice thing to have.

f6_assessments.q0:
The goal of the proposal is to adapt the already working nano-credit loan platform to the Cardano ecosystem. The platform is offering nano credits to people from several countries in Latin America, and with the help of ISPO, the proposers will open 2 stake pools and use the rewards created to fund the credits through liquidity providers, and in exchange the delegators will receive a Cardano native token.
The project touches on 2 important points in the loan economy: those who are in need of credit, cannot get it, as they are not formally employed and as such, banks will not assign them credit scores or open them bank accounts and those who would be willing to offer loans to the unbanked have no centralised, official platform to do so.
Given the goal, structure and already working platform, I see the impact this proposal can have on the Cardano ecosystem as highly positive.
f6_assessments.q1:
The timeline and roadmap are very comprehensive. The proposers have posted extra content regarding the project’s prior achievements in the team’s description for a better visualisation of their commitment and skills.
The budget is well detailed and with the important mention, that 50% of it will be covered by their company. The amount is reasonable and realistic.
The team have provided ample details about their previous work and links to their social professional profiles.
Given all the information offered, I find the proposal can be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2:
The KPIs are mostly related to the Stake Pool statistics - how many delegators and how much ADA will be staked at their 2 pools, though some other metrics could have probably also been provided, regarding the number of loans and people using their platform etc. 
The success definition is for the more distant future (end of 2023), and does not have the minimum standard of success for a more immediate future - post ISPOs and first couple of months after launch through the Cardano ecosystem.
However, due to the comprehensive information offered throughout the proposal, these missing details do not detract from the clarity and understanding of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: They want to develop a digital currency collateral lending system. Basically the idea is viable and not too new, can see a lot of digital currency mortgage lending already working through exchanges or other defi platforms on ETH or some have developed on cardano is in progress. But the issue of technical solutions related to security, ensuring the interests of borrowers, local legislation and financial problems for these platforms to be accepted by users are issues that need to be studied in depth. and the involvement of government agencies and experts. Hopefully they will research and provide more bases before deploying a serious enough platform to convince the community on blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1: They have an experienced team and are lending in practice. I find this lending model more civilized than the existing usury models. And the project intends to learn the model of fundraising through ISPO that Meld has deployed. This shows that they have market research and are serious about the project. However, my work team has not seen people with full experience in the blockchain field, hopefully they will add personnel to this shortcoming.
f6_assessments.q2: I see they have not provided full official communication channels. And they are not yet as detailed as the whitepaper so that the community can understand their background more deeply. A lending platform needs to carefully study how it works, clear financial rules when lending. And the audit tools in particular are extremely transparent on the blockchain, but here I have not found this at all in their presentation.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal introduces an application for a large number of borrowers who are not approved for loans by traditional financial institutions, where there is no credit points to borrow. The project's capital is arranged from ADA holders. By staking their ADA to the pool, they will receive back the tokens issued by this project. Borrowers will be provided credit limit at reasonable interest rate through the credit actions and friends of level 1.
By issuing native token, this proposal will mobilize the staking of ADA holders, in the same way of MELD, they will get financial funds to be able to give. This is the key to the success of this project.
This proposal is valuable for the majority of informal workers, who have little access to low-interest loans. This project solves the problem of funding and providing credit to borrowers through technology. In addition, controlling and lowering the risk of bad debts will also make the project more successful.
This proposal meets some criteria of the Challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal’s roadmap is presented in detail with the work and achievement in specific numbers. The milestones by month are very clear.
This is a large-scale proposal that can operate in many countries around the world. The proposal budget is very modest in compare to the project's achievement. Maybe the proposal team through the Catalyst want to communicate about the good values they will bring to the community for Cardano. I have confidence in this project.
This proposal has a strong team of experienced personnel in many fields such as technology, database, application development, ... In addition, they have experienced advisors in many fields directly related to this project. Key persons’ profile information is clear and transparent.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides KPIs determining the success. The work achievements are reported clearly. The timeline with detailed results is presented with specific numbers.
The team with experts well understand the targeted problems, thus give clear solution to address the problems. The project is with huge impact to all men and women, in particular the poor and the vulnerable, enable them to access microfinance, giving them a chance to change for better life.

f6_assessments.q0:
The challenge to provide micro-lending to a wide group of people is a very unique and attractive proposal. The team is willing to impact the community and grow cardano users in key areas of the unbanked. 
On the other hand they wish to fund part of this proposal using a ISPO model, which has been severly resisted by the Cardano community. I leave the decision to the voter over the overall impact of this project if negative or positive.
f6_assessments.q1:
The budget is well described and my expertise allows me to comment in more detail around the SPO costing. I find this part overvalued to maintaining an SPO. 
However the other part of setting up a business is not my expertise but I also find that their budgeting cost is ballooned. 
The team members are well decribed and show a passion to fund and lend the unbanked. They have a ongoing model that they wish to transport into the cardano ecosystem. I value the project and have looked at their timeline and deliverable. I evaluate that section to be effective to deliver a successul project. 

The last challenge that is not mentioned is the resistance of the cardano twitter and social media against ISPO. There has been a huge resistance to acquire the rewards of regular stakers in return for tokens and other rewards. Also the risk of rug pulls and dissapearance of the team in that case becomes a risk. 
I dont condone the method I simply recommend the proposer to find an alternative to the ISPO model and taking all the staking rewards fromthe delgators of their SPO.
f6_assessments.q2:
The audit section is well described for the SPO section and the number of stake wallets and value of ADA staked for each phase of the project. Since this is very public and on the blockchain there is not risk. 
However the backbone of this project relies on the lending mechanism and the structure around that. There has not been any details for this section described for the audit and traceability of the succes of the project yet. 
Maybe more to come in the future, if proposer can update this section.

solution: We're giving loans to the informal economy; our collaborative credit score is better at assessing risk & our default rate is 2x lower.
experience: Our leadership team has strong experience in the financial and mobility industries, having led global companies in the LatAm market. We are backed by several institutions and angel investors with long industry expertise.
